success.description: Whether the API call was successful
Whether the API call was successful

GET /zones.description:
Lists, searches, sorts, and filters your zones. Listing zones across more than 500 accounts
is currently not allowed.

schema.description:
A domain name. Optional filter operators can be provided to extend refine the search:
  * `equal` (default)
  * `not_equal`
  * `starts_with`
  * `ends_with`
  * `contains`
  * `starts_with_case_sensitive`
  * `ends_with_case_sensitive`
  * `contains_case_sensitive`

An account Name. Optional filter operators can be provided to extend refine the search:
  * `equal` (default)
  * `not_equal`
  * `starts_with`
  * `ends_with`
  * `contains`
  * `starts_with_case_sensitive`
  * `ends_with_case_sensitive`
  * `contains_case_sensitive`
Whether to match all search requirements or at least one (any).

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

account.description: The account the zone belongs to

activated_on.description:
The last time proof of ownership was detected and the zone was made
active

development_mode.description:
The interval (in seconds) from when development mode expires
(positive integer) or last expired (negative integer) for the
domain. If development mode has never been enabled, this value is 0.

cdn_only.description: The zone is only configured for CDN

custom_certificate_quota.description: Number of Custom Certificates the zone can have

dns_only.description: The zone is only configured for DNS

foundation_dns.description: The zone is setup with Foundation DNS

page_rule_quota.description: Number of Page Rules a zone can have

phishing_detected.description: The zone has been flagged for phishing

modified_on.description: When the zone was last modified

name_servers.description: The name servers Cloudflare assigns to a zone

original_dnshost.description: DNS host at the time of switching to Cloudflare

original_name_servers.description: Original name servers before moving to Cloudflare

original_registrar.description: Registrar for the domain at the time of switching to Cloudflare

paused.description:
Indicates whether the zone is only using Cloudflare DNS services. A
true value means the zone will not receive security or performance
benefits.

type.description:
A full zone implies that DNS is hosted with Cloudflare. A partial zone is
typically a partner-hosted zone or a CNAME setup.

vanity_name_servers.description: An array of domains used for custom name servers. This is only available for Business and Enterprise plans.

PATCH /zones/{zone_id}.description: Edits a zone. Only one zone property can be changed at a time.

paused.description:
Indicates whether the zone is only using Cloudflare DNS services. A
true value means the zone will not receive security or performance
benefits.

plan.description:
(Deprecated) Please use the `/zones/{zone_id}/subscription` API
to update a zone's plan. Changing this value will create/cancel
associated subscriptions. To view available plans for this zone,
see Zone Plans.

type.description:
A full zone implies that DNS is hosted with Cloudflare. A partial
zone is typically a partner-hosted zone or a CNAME setup. This
parameter is only available to Enterprise customers or if it has
been explicitly enabled on a zone.

vanity_name_servers.description:
An array of domains used for custom name servers. This is only
available for Business and Enterprise plans.

POST /zones/{zone_id}/purge_cache.description:
### Purge All Cached Content
Removes ALL files from Cloudflare's cache. All tiers can purge everything.
```
{"purge_everything": true}
```

### Purge Cached Content by URL
Granularly removes one or more files from Cloudflare's cache by specifying URLs. All tiers can purge by URL.

To purge files with custom cache keys, include the headers used to compute the cache key as in the example. If you have a device type or geo in your cache key, you will need to include the CF-Device-Type or CF-IPCountry headers. If you have lang in your cache key, you will need to include the Accept-Language header.

**NB:** When including the Origin header, be sure to include the **scheme** and **hostname**. The port number can be omitted if it is the default port (80 for http, 443 for https), but must be included otherwise.

**NB:** For Zones on Free/Pro/Business plan, you may purge up to 30 URLs in one API call. For Zones on Enterprise plan, you may purge up to 500 URLs in one API call.

Single file purge example with files:
```
{"files": ["http://www.example.com/css/styles.css", "http://www.example.com/js/index.js"]}
```
Single file purge example with url and header pairs:
```
{"files": [{url: "http://www.example.com/cat_picture.jpg", headers: { "CF-IPCountry": "US", "CF-Device-Type": "desktop", "Accept-Language": "zh-CN" }}, {url: "http://www.example.com/dog_picture.jpg", headers: { "CF-IPCountry": "EU", "CF-Device-Type": "mobile", "Accept-Language": "en-US" }}]}
```

### Purge Cached Content by Tag, Host or Prefix
Granularly removes one or more files from Cloudflare's cache either by specifying the host, the associated Cache-Tag, or a Prefix. Only Enterprise customers are permitted to purge by Tag, Host or Prefix.

**NB:** Cache-Tag, host, and prefix purging each have a rate limit of 30,000 purge API calls in every 24 hour period. You may purge up to 30 tags, hosts, or prefixes in one API call. This rate limit can be raised for customers who need to purge at higher volume.

Flex purge with tags:
```
{"tags": ["a-cache-tag", "another-cache-tag"]}
```
Flex purge with hosts:
```
{"hosts": ["www.example.com", "images.example.com"]}
```
Flex purge with prefixes:
```
{"prefixes": ["www.example.com/foo", "images.example.com/bar/baz"]}
```

Flex Purge with Hosts.summary: Flex purge example with hosts list

Flex Purge with Prefixes.summary: Flex purge example with prefixes list

Flex Purge with Tags.summary: Flex purge example with tags list

Single File Purge.summary: Single file purge example with files list

Single File Purge with UrlAndHeaders.summary: Single file purge example with url and headers list

tags.description: For more information on cache tags and purging by tags, please refer to [purge by cache-tags documentation page](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache/purge-by-tags/#purge-cache-by-cache-tags-enterprise-only).

hosts.description: For more information purging by hostnames, please refer to [purge by hostname documentation page](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache/purge-by-hostname/).

prefixes.description: For more information on purging by prefixes, please refer to [purge by prefix documentation page](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache/purge_by_prefix/).

purge_everything.description: For more information, please refer to [purge everything documentation page](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache/purge-everything/).

files.description: For more information on purging files, please refer to [purge by single-file documentation page](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache/purge-by-single-file/).

For more information on purging files with URL and headers, please refer to [purge by single-file documentation page](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache/purge-by-single-file/).

anyOf.title: Purge files with URL and headers

Whether the API call was successful

PUT /zones/{zone_id}/activation_check.description:
Triggeres a new activation check for a PENDING Zone. This can be
triggered every 5 min for paygo/ent customers, every hour for FREE
Zones.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful
Whether the API call was successful
